Overview This position contributes to the success of the PepsiCo Beverages North America (PBNA) by ensuring regulatory compliance (OSHA, EPA, and DOT), accident prevention and after injury management. This person will work to support implementation of the PBNA EHS Management System at the Stone Mountain, GA manufacturing/warehousing location. The ideal candidate will be a subject matter expert in employee safety and environmental regulations as well as have OSHA, EPA, and DOT compliance experience and be highly skilled at implementing processes that will lead to sustained EHS performance improvements. This person is responsible for deploying, implementing, and leading the EHS agenda by supporting the location manufacturing teams with integration of safety and environmental programs, Workers' Compensation, prevention efforts, and regulatory compliance into everyday work life. The EHS Manager has responsibility to analyze accident data and develop and implement actionable safety/environmental solutions. The candidate is expected to provide collaborative, proactive, and creative problem-solving abilities to develop best-in-class EHS programs for the improvement of the overall strategy and EHS management system. Responsibilities Implement, execute, ensure compliance with the Pepsi - North American Beverages EHS policies and procedures, and all federal, state, and local OSHA/EPA/ (i.e. Lockout, Haz Com, Machine Safety, SARA, RCRA, etc.) Manage local EHS budget Lead the development and implementation of the EHS Annual Operating Plans and EHS Action Plans for the location Achieve annual targets rates for Lost Time, Recordable, Severity, and Environmental Ensure compliance with applicable occupational safety and environmental regulations Develop, implement, execute, and manage strategies to prevent workplace injuries, and environmental incidents Demonstrate solid employee relations experience, interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills Display strong problem solving, organizational and analytical skills Demonstrate professional maturity and ability to act as a change leader by influencing all levels of the organization to drive continuous improvement in safety performance Conduct EHS activities such as training/auditing/assessing to ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory agency requirements, Zero Zone Management System standards, Emergency Response and internal PepsiCo EHS procedures Perform risk assessments and assist in the implementation of effective physical and/ or behavioral control measures. Recognize and verify the effectiveness of in-place control measures Identify unsafe equipment operation and conditions while demonstrating knowledge of appropriate corrective action for unsafe conditions or equipment use Exercise a leadership, coordination, and communication role with the location leadership to drive continuous EHS improvement across the location Complete root cause analyses and develop corrective action plans to address root basic causes and management system weak-spots through the use of industry-recognized cause analysis techniques Serves as subject matter expert (SME) for key environmental programs, such as wastewater, ammonia, emergency response, etc. Provides templates and other tools to assists Sectors in the development and deployment of facility-specific environmental programs (e.g., Emergency Response, Spills, Stormwater, etc.) and external environmental reports to regulatory agencies Provides proactive and reactive environmental compliance and risk management program consultation to all Global Sectors and sites Builds and delivers environmental risk management and compliance programming tools and training materials Tracks and reviews environmental program performance metrics and incident data and assists the Senior Director with updating the strategic plans Develops and delivers environmental compliance and risk management training programs for sites in all Global Sectors and multiple environmental program elements in various media Works with Sectors to develop annual environmental operating plans and track progress-to-plan Works with PepsiCo Legal teams to craft and strategize on potential Notice of Violations, exceedances, and other like regulatory activities Evaluates capital and innovation projects to determine environmental impacts, environmental compliance requirements, and environmental risk control needs Works with Global Sector EHS Managers as needed to support application for and review of environmental permits, as required, assuring on-going facility compliance and operating permits Participates on environmental significant incident investigations, root cause analyses, and incident corrective actions, including tracking to closure Supports Global EHS environmental and EHS audit processes Supports roll-out of environmental information/task management systems, such as MyEHS across Global Sectors Selects and manages environmental consultants and contractors to achieve Global environmental program goals Represents environmental interests (e.g., compliance, permitting, waste management, risk management program implementation, Early Management, Management of Change, etc.) to PepsiCo functional teams and Sector leadership. Provides input to the PepsiCo Legal Department via legal review submittals for environmental issues Identifies new environmental regulatory obligations and other requirements through a regulatory applicability analysis (RAA) process Coach and mentor other Environmental team members within the organization and use strong influencing skills around EHS goals/values Create and deliver training materials and communications to expand capability in the defined subject matter Qualifications Basic Job Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree with greater than 10 years’ work experience in EHS Effective communication and interpersonal skills including public speaking skills and presence in meetings and training environments Demonstrate excellent organizational skills use PC and related software (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) handle multiple priorities and meet critical deadlines Ability to make and deliver training presentations work collaboratively with colleagues to create a results driven. "Team oriented environment maintain confidentiality make independent decisions Functional EHS knowledge in regulatory requirements, EHS technical aspects (safety, industrial hygiene, environmental regulatory management, risk management, behavior-based safety, training, regulatory agency enforcement Travel up to 10% (dependent on business needs and fluctuation) Displays strong problem solving, organizational and analytical skills. Strong project management skills including financial responsibility, budgeting, scheduling, vendor management, execution and startup/commissioning, managing multiple concurrent projects/programs. Demonstrates professional maturity and ability to act as a change leader. Understands and can articulate environmental regulations. Preferred Job Qualifications: ASP, CSP, CIH, and/or CHMM desirable Bachelor’s degree EHS management experience in a related industry, including consumer packaged goods, distribution/transportation, manufacturing or grocery industry Knowledge and experience with EHS Management systems and their deployment EHS auditing work experience Solid working knowledge of EHS regulatory compliance 3 - 5 years of increasingly responsible work experience in the safety or environmental field. Displays strong problem solving, organizational and analytical skills. Strong project management skills including financial responsibility, budgeting, scheduling, vendor management, execution and startup/commissioning, managing multiple concurrent projects/programs. Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. For specific information, please discuss role requirements with the recruiter.

Overview The Supply Chain Director of Engineering will provide engineering direction, technical input and management of PBNA Supply Chain on capital management, capacity, innovation, and cost management of projects as well as infrastructure work, utility and support systems and strategic initiatives. The individual in this position will provide management oversight over all locations in the West Division inclusive of process improvement, engineering design, support and trouble shooting. This position works closely with Sector Operations, Package and Product Development, Procurement, Change Management and external suppliers. This position is responsible for driving standardization and serving as a technical resource to not only the plants but also the warehouses across the division. This role will also have an extremely high emphasis on Quality, Environmental Health and Safety and our People First Agenda. Responsibilities Lead a team of Sr Project Engineers/Managers and manage the execution of capital investment projects involving capacity, process & utilities, infrastructure, vertical integration, innovation and value engineering projects Provide guidance and leadership on equipment specifications and standards Provide strategic insights and direction to cross functional teams on new initiatives Manage an annual Capital plan which addresses capacity, capability & infrastructure Act as a change manager/coordinator with all business partners Manage, hire and coach direct reports, exempt and non-exempt. Explore, evaluate and implement new technology and techniques to enhance and improve upon current practices Engage with leadership to champion initiatives Facilitate weekly and monthly report outs to Division leadership Work closely with Operations, EHS, consulting partners, external vendors and equipment OEMs to drive standardization and serve as a technical liaison to plants to help address their challenges for the short and long term. Auto req ID: 219238BR Job Description This position contributes to the success of the PepsiCo Beverages North America (PBNA) by ensuring regulatory compliance (OSHA, EPA, and DOT), accident prevention and after injury management. This person will work to support implementation of the PBNA EHS Management System at the Hayward, CA Manufacturing location. The ideal candidate will be a subject matter expert in employee safety and environmental regulations as well as have OSHA, EPA, and DOT compliance experience and be highly skilled at implementing processes that will lead to sustained EHS performance improvements. This person is responsible for deploying, implementing, and leading the EHS agenda by supporting the location manufacturing teams with the integration of safety and environmental programs, Workers' Compensation, prevention efforts, and regulatory compliance into everyday work life. The EHS Senior Resource has the responsibility to analyze accident data and develop and implement actionable safety/environmental solutions. The candidate is expected to provide collaborative, proactive, and creative problem-solving abilities to develop best-in-class EHS programs for the improvement of the overall strategy and EHS management system. Major Tasks, Key Responsibilities And Key Accountabilities Implement, execute, ensure compliance with the Pepsi - North American Beverages EHS policies and procedures, and all federal, state, and local OSHA/EPA/DOT regulations (i.e. Lockout, Haz Com, Machine Safety, SARA, RCRA, etc.) Manage local EHS budget Lead the development and implementation of the EHS Annual Operating Plans and EHS Action Plans for the location Achieve annual targets rates for Lost Time, Recordable, Severity, and Environmental Ensure compliance with applicable federal and state occupational safety and environmental regulations Develop, implement, execute, and manage strategies to prevent workplace injuries, environmental incidents Demonstrate solid employee relations experience, interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills Display strong problem solving, organizational and analytical skills Demonstrate professional maturity and ability to act as a change leader by influencing all levels of the organization to drive continuous improvement in safety performance Conduct EHS activities such as training/auditing/assessing to ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory agency requirements, Zero Zone Management System standards, Emergency Response and internal PepsiCo EHS procedures Perform risk assessments and assist in the implementation of effective physical and/or behavioral control measures. Recognize and verify the effectiveness of in-place control measures Identify unsafe equipment operation and conditions while demonstrating knowledge of appropriate corrective action for unsafe conditions or equipment use Exercise a leadership, coordination, and communication role with the location leadership to drive continuous EHS improvement across the location Complete root cause analyses and develop corrective action plans to address root basic causes and management system weak-spots through the use of industry-recognized cause analysis techniques Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor's Degree with 5 years’ work experience in EHS Effective communication and interpersonal skills including public speaking skills and presence in meetings and training environments Ability to: make and deliver training presentations work collaboratively with colleagues to create a results-driven, team-oriented environment maintain confidentiality make independent decisions demonstrate excellent organizational skills use PC and related software (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) handle multiple priorities and meet critical deadlinesPreferred Job Qualifications: Safety management experience in a related industry, including consumer packaged goods, distribution/transportation, manufacturing or grocery industry Safety degree and/or related certification Knowledge and experience with EHS Management systems and their deployment EHS auditing ASP, CSP, CIH, and/or CHMM desirable Relocation Eligible: Eligible for Limited Relocation Job Type: Regular All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. Overview The Executive Compensation HR Operations Manager is a critical role in HR Operations (HR Ops) responsible for managing key areas of Executive Compensation responsibilities on a day-to-day basis. This position will independently manage all aspects of Executive Compensation Program Management which will include managing Long-Term Incentive (LTI) grant cycles, LTI choice and Board of Directors plan and all other aspects by partnering with HR Ops sector leads, external vendor, Total Rewards COE, legal, treasury, finance team members to ensure seamless execution. In addition, this role will be responsible for managing onshore team member, partner with offshore team members, day-to-day vendor relationships and technology development, and communications related to Executive Compensation. This highly visible position will also be responsible for system implementation or changes, preparing and presenting scorecard/dashboard presentations to key stakeholders, sector CHROs, Total Rewards and Global HR Operations leadership teams on Executive Compensation related matters. In addition, this role will support the initiatives of other global HR Operations systems including but not limited to New Functionality, Change Management, Reporting, Data Integration and maintenance of security. This unique opportunity will potentially create several career paths after successfully completing an assignment in Executive Compensation HR Operations. These opportunities include but are not limited to other HR Operations roles at Corporate Headquarters or sectors, other specialist or broader roles within the Corporate Control, Finance, Total Rewards or HR functions Responsibilities Close partnership with Total Rewards COE to support on various initiatives and execution of design and governance changes Serve as a single point of contact with finance, legal teams to adhere to program management activities globally Partner with cross-functional team members for settlement of annual and offcycle awards Manage day to today relationship with vendor partner to bring external perspective and develop scorecards Independently manage annual LTI award choice window for executives globally and lead end-to-end grant generation cycle of annual, pro-rata, and special LTI awards Partner with legal team to finalize Terms and Conditions of LTI awards for grant acceptance process Perform duties as a SOX Control/Process Owner for the Exec Comp HR Operations team to ensure all SOX documentation is up to date as a part of quarterly SOX sign-off process Manage onshore team member and partner with offshore team members Note:- COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law. Qualifications Deep experience in HR Operations, or Total Rewards (Compensation, Benefits, Executive Compensation) is a must. Specifically, handling global programs, confidential data, and complex issue resolution etc. Experience in managing or administering global equity compensation programs for a large organization preferred Should have worked in or supported an operating business, and ideally have experience with the executive population At least 7-8 years of professional experience, preferably in a global corporation in HR or a related field Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Human Resources or related experience required Strong data analysis skills couple with knowledge of SAP HCM or a similar HRMS system Effectively communicate with different constituencies and stakeholders via multiple channels (e.g., presentations, conference calls, email) Good project management skills and experience implementing complex projects Ability to manage external vendors and collaboration with cross-functional team members is a must Effective problem-solving skills; proactive approach to identify risks and propose solutions High degree of initiative and attention to detail with minimal day-to-day supervision Ability to manage concurrent assignments/projects and identify priorities Less than 10% travel POSITION DETAILS Location: Purchase, NY, United States or Mexico city, Mexico. Responsibilities This is your opportunity to take your financial and analytical skills to the next level with endless possibilities! General Summary: The Credit Risk Associate Analyst is a key asset to the Credit Risk COE, heavily involved in the day-to-day management of credit risk mitigation strategies with a key emphasis on credit review, processing, reporting and maintenance of customer and/or supplier data. The volume, complexity, and divergent sources of information to review in this position requires an understanding of accounting and finance. This position will primarily work across several business lines and utilize multiple operating platforms. The volume and complexity of the work requires a self-driven individual willing to go above and beyond. Major Task Responsibilities and Key Accountabilities: Credit Processes: 60% Review new customer credit applications, analyzing customer credit worthiness, documenting, and defending position Act as single point of contact for field partner and/or credit customer escalations/remediation Review and analyze various trade and financial publications to determine and identify potential negative customer trends Evaluate, prioritize, and monitor accounts to ascertain credit risk Assist with defining risk mitigation strategies for high risk and post-petition bankruptcy accounts Assist the Credit Risk group with quantitative and qualitative analysis Network with sales and credit professionals to assess market and channel risk Evaluate strategies to help reduce retail and supplier customer risk Special Projects/Analytics: 25% Lead ad hoc projects designed to optimize the credit risk mitigation platform Stay abreast with current industry technology/practice to influence direction Analytically mine portfolio for watch scenarios to minimize losses Creatively challenges norms Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. Overview Join an industry leader and a winning team and be a part of a company that sells over $13 billion of Fun Foods made at our manufacturing facilities! You will be rewarded with generous opportunities for career growth, a competitive compensation package, and comprehensive benefits. This is a leadership role that will be based in Massillon, OH leading the Canton OTR Fleet Team. The OTR Fleet Manager role will lead the Canton OTR Fleet field team within the region increasing capability and driving performance. Responsible for managing the budget, financial performance in Repair and Maintenance, Fuel, Rentals, and Tires. The annual operating budget that this role has direct impact on is approx. $6M. From a service standpoint, the role has the responsibility for reliability performance of over the road fleet assets. This role will have direct reports that include 5 Fleet Technicians and 1 Lead Technician. This is a strategic role that will require influence and collaboration across functions as well as exceptional Leadership Management and Development of talent pipeline. Responsibilities Lead local Fleet Team to deliver the cost, quality, service, and reliability results set out in the annual Fleet Capability plan. Partner with the Fleet Service Center team that supports the outside vendor maintenance service and parts ordering. Utilize, implement, and execute national tactics to drive World Class Service & Performance Build a specific strategic plan to drive Fleet performance. Develop and manage a comprehensive asset utilization plan for maximum asset availability Align with site, region and fleet HQ management on annual fleet financial plan, productivity and tactical/strategic initiatives Execute a fuel maintenance conservation plan to reduce fuel usage and improve overall MPG Manage all regulatory compliance (DOT, EPA, SMART, OSHA and FDA) Manage approximately 6 direct reports Responsibility for key accounts including repair and maintenance, fuel, rentals, and tires for local location Develop technical and non-technical capability of the fleet technicians Build and sustain strong business relationships with Transportation Operations. This job description should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. Employees will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as may be required by their supervisor. Qualifications Minimum Job Requirements: Bachelor's Degree 5+ years previous experience in fleet maintenance or logistics preferred Supply Chain experience Intermediate computer systems knowledge Knowledge & experience with DOT guidelines Fleet or similar CMMS experience Ability to manage front line employees and Leaders Effective interaction skills with leadership, subordinates, and peers Ability to influence cross functional teams Demonstrated Change Management experience Excellent writing and analytical skills Leadership skills including coaching, facilitation, presentation and team building Lean Six Sigma experience preferred Flexible - willingness to work off shifts, holidays, and weekends as necessary based on business need Travel up to 10% Physical Requirements: Frequent standing and walking Sitting occasionally to frequent Lifting up to 20 pounds occasionally Must be able to see (depth perception, near acuity and far acuity) and hear Must be able to maneuver safely around moving equipment and/or in congested manufacturing areas Must be able to tolerate extreme temperatures (hot and/or cold depending upon season) Must pass a drug screen and background investigation Must be able to wear personal protective equipment including safety glasses, ear plugs/muffs, steel toed shoes, rubber gloves/boots, etc. Exposed to various cleaning chemicals, lubricants, etc. Note: Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. For specific information, please discuss role requirements with the recruiter.

Overview PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated more than $66 billion in net revenue in 2014, driven by a complementary food and beverage portfolio that includes Frito-Lay, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Quaker and Tropicana. PepsiCo's product portfolio includes a wide range of enjoyable foods and beverages, including 22 brands that generate more than $1 billion each in estimated annual retail sales. At the heart of PepsiCo is Performance with Purpose – our goal to deliver top-tier financial performance while creating sustainable growth and shareholder value. In practice, Performance with Purpose means providing a wide range of foods and beverages from treats to healthy eats; finding innovative ways to minimize our impact on the environment and reduce our operating costs; providing a safe and inclusive workplace for our employees globally; and respecting, supporting and investing in the local communities where we operate. Equal Opportunity Employer: Minority/Female/Disability Protected Veteran. For more information, visitwww.pepsico.com. Functional Description: PepsiCo provides a demanding, fast-paced environment in a competitive industry, where growth equals opportunity and fun accompanies the challenge. Does leading a team of 8-10 sales reps within your first two years excite you? Does spearheading a $10-15MM business sound rewarding? If so, PepsiCo might be the organization for you. As a leader of this Fortune 500 Company, you are called upon to make decisions in “real time” to maintain and grow an existing account base with a strong focus on customer relations. Assignments are based on functional knowledge versus defined time periods. Based on performance, candidates will have the unique opportunity to move rapidly to increasing levels of responsibility culminating in leadership positions in sales, sales operations, food service and possible cross functional and enterprise-wide roles. We are looking for future leaders of the company; our campus hires begin their career with unlimited career growth potential! Our college recruiting program is designed to build future leaders within our organization and groom candidates for key leadership roles. Technology: PepsiCo is on the cutting edge of mobile technology in the consumer-packaged goods marketplace. The following outlines a list of technology opportunities you will have available to you in this role: Mobile technology (software and hardware) for constant connectivity for all roles in the Sales function, leveraging consumer-grade devices (i.e. iPad, iPhone) that are upgraded to the latest availability in the market. Mobile Apps continuously refined to help the frontline and its leaders guide their teams and accomplish their goals. Mobile file sharing tools to support collaboration among teams and peers Real-time data and analytics on key performance indicators and product insights Mobile selling applications that leverage cutting edge technology, like augmented reality to virtually depict business leaders’ ideas for customers. What you can expect: At PepsiCo, our internships are project-based. Your management team will assign you a specific project which will have a tangible impact on our business. We also encourage you to engage in internal networking activities with our senior leadership team. Keep in mind, when you work for PepsiCo, you will have access to a variety of operating models within the Beverage, Foods and Corporate environments; this means that you can support power brands such as Tropicana, Gatorade, Quaker & Frito-Lay and still work within the same company! Mobile file sharing tools to support collaboration among teams and peers Real-time data and analytics on key performance indicators and product insights Mobile selling applications that leverage cutting edge technology, like augmented reality to virtually depict business leaders’ ideas for customers. Overview Why PepsiCo? PepsiCo’s mission is to ‘Create more smiles with every sip and every bite.’ PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. PepsiCo generated $79 billion in net revenue in 2021, driven by a complementary beverage and convenient foods portfolio that includes Lay's, Doritos, Cheetos, Gatorade, Pepsi-Cola, Mountain Dew, Quaker, and SodaStream. Guiding PepsiCo is our vision that captures PepsiCo’s competitive spirit, intense focus, and shared values: to Be the Global Leader in Beverages and Convenient Foods by Winning with PepsiCo Positive (pep+). pep+ is our strategic end-to-end transformation that puts sustainability and human capital at the center of how we will create value and growth by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for planet and people. We are on a journey from awareness to commitment to action. And we’re proud of the progress we’ve made in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace for our associates. It’s an approach that extends to our business partners, communities and future generations. Why PepsiCo Design? 40 plus brands, 300 plus multidisciplinary creatives in 16 offices, united in harnessing the power of design for positive change in every region of the world. We're a group of fearless optimists who approach each day with the passion of a startup. Our brands and experiences bring excitement, refreshment and fun to people around the globe. At our core, we're people obsessed with people. We use a human-centered approach to create meaningful, authentic and relevant brand experiences. Our Opportunity: The Global Equipment Design Senior Manager is responsible for developing the global visual design language on beverage dispense platforms (Fountain / Vending / Coolers), leveraging design thinking to embed consumer needs, customer needs, technical feasibility, business needs and sustainability needs in unlocking Foodservice opportunities for both PBNA and international markets. They will lead the day-to-day design development, management and execution of the new global beverage equipment dispense programs. They will identify key stakeholders and continue to strengthen relationships with our Foodservice business leads, our regional design centers, our regional R&D teams, and regional supply chain partners. Successful candidates will demonstrate superior hands-on design thinking/strategy capability, superior design development process and execution, ability to drive executive alignment and ability to drive strategic discussions with key stakeholders. L11 Design candidates role/experience at PepsiCo should prepare them for a stronger creative leadership and management role within the Design Center. Responsibilities Strategic Design Leadership: Develop the global equipment visual design language. A successful candidate will be able to build strong brand experiences with the beverage dispense equipment platform that meets the diverse market needs. They will also be able to leverage design thinking processes to help unlock new equipment innovation opportunities. A successful candidate will then develop a holistic global equipment visual design language across PBNA and international beverage markets Product Design Leadership: Utilize a proper design process to lead the team in translating brand values into meaningful equipment design elements, in identifying consumer unmet needs, in developing mood boards/frameworks, in sketch 2D explorations, in generating 3D CAD models, in prototyping and in exploring Color, Materials and Finish options. A successful candidate will maintain clear communication, status, and project workflow with Global Brand Design teams, Regional Design Centers, Regional Business Owners and R&D teams They will identify and promote self-initiated equipment projects that generate critical business value for PepsiCo and/or that create new consumer brand experiences. A successful candidate must be able to lead design workshops with key internal stakeholders by using a 3 lens approach in developing holistic beverage equipment platform solutions that closely links brand, product, equipment, consumer needs and business viability Design Project Management: Responsible for partnering across disciplines within PepsiCo and external teams to drive final design recommendations, decisions, and design approval to enable that final commercial 3D beverage structural packaging designs and design guidelines are developed and delivered on-time. Energizes and leads both internal design partners and external design resources from idea phase to launch. Ensures each stakeholder understands his/her role and responsibilities throughout the creative process. Regularly reviews the status of projects with appropriate leadership to verify that creative and strategic communications expectations are met External Design Network: Supports the PepsiCo Design Organization in building and cultivating a strong external design network Compensation: The expected compensation range for this position is between $ 100,500- $168,150 Location, confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 15% of annual salary paid out annually Long term incentive equity may be awarded based on eligibility and performance. Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan Qualifications 10+ years of product design and design innovation experience. Product Design, Design Innovation and Structural Packaging experiences beneficial (preferably in a global and matrix-ed environment or working as consultant from a design firm for such organizations) Through past experience and case studies, demonstrates strong hands-on design ability creating strong consumer brand experience solutions BFA or BS in product design Extraordinary design taste and skill Strong design and development process Extraordinary knowledge of 3D modeling and rendering Extraordinary form-factor exploration, great sketching ability and modeling skills Deep understanding of engineering processes and product manufacturability Good communicator that presents their ideas clearly and with conviction Excellent, creative problem solving Strong conceptual designing skills Excellent presentation skills across all levels Taking an idea beyond theory and analysis into execution Collaborative, flexible and tenacious; able to preserver to realize goals Works well with others to deliver results; keeps others informed and can share successes broadly Proven ability to effectively incorporate research (including primary and secondary research) in strategic design processes Track record of building strategic efforts across business units Can effectively envision and address idea feasibility Superior project management and design management skills; attention to detail Proven ability to multi-task, and ability to work in an ambiguous and dynamic work environment; comfortable handling risk and uncertainty Informal influencing at senior levels in the organization across sectors and functions Must be willing and able to travel 15% of the time COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. jobTitle: Global IBP Demand Planning Sr Director
jobDescription: Responsibilities Position Location:- This role can be located in the following North America HQ locations: Plano - Texas, Purchase – New York Global IBP Demand Planning (DP) Sr Director As part of a global IBP CoE team, define, implement and continuously improve demand planning (DP) processes (including organisational structures), and support the build and implementation of DP digital products and capabilities (e.g. training, UAT, etc). DP in PepsiCo is incorporated into integrated business planning (IBP), which includes integrated sales and operations execution (short-term planning), integrated sales and operations planning (mid-term planning) and integrated strategic planning (long-term planning) Detailed Role and Responsibilities: Help architect the DP vision, processes, products and capabilities. Tailor the most appropriate DP processes to be embraced by the organization to achieve management objectives Ensure that business and user requirements are identified and addressed through the design and implementation of these processes, products and capabilities. Document current and future processes in DP playbooks and update them when needed, including the connectivity of DP processes with IBP, supply planning (source, make, deliver, etc), commercial planning (promo, innovation, etc) , financial planning processes, as well as daily operational execution. Identify and document which processes or activities should be automated, centralised or eliminated. Identify and document the appropriate organisational structures to operate these DP processes in the most efficient and effective manner. Align and document any changes to the DP processes as impacted by other changes (e.g., organizational or process changes in supply chain, finance, marketing and sales) Generate and help document the DP systems and DP system architecture functional requirements (including UI, UX and data and analytics requirements), together with enterprise architecture, IT, digital product and D&A teams (including supporting any relevant RFPs) Implement and sustain new DP processes, systems and organisational structures and handover to demand planners in the business. Manage or support projects to implement continuous improvements to these processes. May be asked to lead the planning/functional/process team in IBP and DP implementations in his/her location. Identify industry best practices and propose their adoption. Channel continuous improvement ideas and help select suitable ones to turn into projects. Govern the overall standard and health of DP and transformational or continuous improvement changes. Assess process maturity with demand planners across different business units and geographies. Build internal and external demand planning networks and communities, ensuring awareness as well as sharing best practices and developments in the DP arena. Nurture and maintain clear and strong links to corporate and sectors, different functions and stakeholders, driving co-creation and alignment in design and implementation of DP. Manage a small team of IBP CoE demand planning team, directing work flow by assigning tasks, reviewing the work of team members, monitoring the work habits of team members, evaluating team member performance and providing feedback opportunities for team members. Lead the hiring, training and onboarding of new IBP DP members, and ensure an adequate talent pipeline. Note:- COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law. Qualifications Extensive knowledge and experience in demand planning. Extensive knowledge and experience in project management and continuous improvement. Team player, you understand your role, you welcome collaboration, you are flexible, you have a positive attitude, you hold yourself accountable and you commit to the team. Excellent communication, facilitation, conflict resolution, influencing and presentation skills Excellent strategic thinking skills that enable you to use critical thinking to solve complex problems and plan for the future and accomplish business objectives, overcome obstacles, and address challenges. Responsibilities The Health and Safety Coordinator is responsible for assisting the Safety Manager in promoting and sustaining a safe work environment in order to avoid and minimize Health and Safety related problems. These problems include but are not limited to prevention of human injury, emergency response and unsafe working conditions/practices. This is done through health, safety, training, programs, and processes with a visible and uncompromised commitment to the protection of the environment as well as the productivity of the Company’s employees. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to satisfactorily perform each essential requirements represents the knowledge, skill, and/or ability. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodation for disabilities may be made for one or more of the following: Safety: Provide day-to-day support of plant activities including safety aspects which include daily employee safety, machine guarding, personal protective equipment, consulting on safety matters and responsible for safety system analysis, review, anticipate, identify, and evaluate hazardous conditions and practices Coordinate and facilitate site wide training programs, including planning training sessions, updates, and site-specific presentations for the Rancho Cucamonga facility. Safety Program Implementation: Implement site safety programs and ensure compliance with federal, state, local and corporate compliance. Coordinate with SAFETY Manager to roll-out new safety standards and best practices. Work with plant staff to implement new site Safety Standards. OSHA and CUPA Compliance: Interact with OSHA and CUPA inspectors and representatives during plant inspections. Provide relevant citation data and photographs to corporate safety personnel. Partner with SAFETY Manager to determine citations eligible for challenge. Near-Miss / Accident Investigations: Lead and facilitate incident investigations with site leadership. Assess accidents and near misses and perform Root Cause Analyses. Analyze investigation results and analyze trends to ensure a reduction in future accidents. Plant Safety Culture Leadership: Lead plant Safety Committee and promote employee engagement to develop an active and robust safety culture. Schedule and plan monthly Safety Committee meetings. SAFETY Rep Leadership: Coordinate and Monitor on-site SAFETY Representatives, ensuring proper training and equipment is available. Conduct daily, weekly, and monthly safety audits per facility audit schedule. Support the site safety standards, equivalent to ISO 14001 and 45001 Worker’s Compensation : Responsible for timely filing of Workers’ Compensation claims with third party administrator and maintains correspondence and written information related to employee Workers’ compensation claims Reviews restrictions and matches restrictions with available and appropriate transitional duty assignments as assigned. Periodically contacts employees on Transitional duty or lost time. Coordinate Return to work / Modified duty programs. Monitors and arranges for timely return to work of employees. Maintains OSHA logs, injury, absence, modified / transitional duty, and other alternative electronic data methods. Prepares reports for OSHA compliance. Manages, maintains and submits annual OSHA recordkeeping forms Other: Conduct daily, weekly, and monthly safety audits per facility audit schedule. Maintain and monitor compliance calendar to ensure timely regulatory compliance. Work in team environment, coordinate and manage multiple projects and assignments, analyze process data, troubleshoot plant operations, and assist in the implementation of solutions. Perform “on-call” duties on rotation with the supervisory team. Be part of an effective team within the plant that works well with other functions; sales, marketing, finance, human resources, engineering and corporate EHS. Qualifications To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Combines both logical and conceptual thinking to draw conclusions from complex information Demonstrates initiative and ownership in seeking and addressing opportunities and correction or overcoming problems Collaborative actions in support of SAFETY corporate programs and local objectives Demonstrates high energy Displays intellectual curiosity; thinks innovatively Strong communication skills; ability to speak to groups at all professional levels Takes responsibility for own personal growth and development Problem solver; does what is correct on their own Team builder; develops relationships and works well with others Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision Self-motivated, self manages and disciplined Ability to work in a time conscious and time-effective manner. Education And/or Experience Safety related bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. 4 or more years’ experience in safety/health and industrial hygiene (OSHA) compliance preferred. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently. Successful in both team and individual-based work environments. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Proficient in basic computer software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc). PHYSICAL DEMANDS, WORK ENVIRONMENT, HEALTH AND SAFETY Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk and sit for extended periods of time. Requires eye-hand coordination, repetitive hand and arm movement and manual dexterity use of hands to finger, handle, or feel. Reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, listen and speak. The employee must frequently bend, reach to shoulder level and lift, carry, push and/or pull up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus. Hearing level is within normal/average range. Work Environment The noise level in the work environment may be loud. Employee will be required to wear personal safety equipment such as safety glasses, hearing protection, and proper steel toe footwear (PPE) in manufacturing areas. Responsibilities We are PepsiCo Supply Chain. We are the game changers, innovators, collaborators and history makers. The ground breakers of the Supply Chain & Logistics space. We are a diverse group, spread across 200 countries and territories, and united by a shared set of values and goals. You know our name through our amazing portfolio, including Tropicana, Pepsi, Frito-Lay, Quaker and Gatorade. We perform with a purpose. We dream globally and act locally, constantly innovating to sustain our planet, our people, our communities and our business practices. Together, we raise the bar in lean manufacturing practices. We put forth new standards and stretch to reach beyond the goals we set. We are a think tank, bringing our ideas into action and are determined to find ways to drive efficiencies, improve processes and achieve the highest level of safety… all while meeting the demands of our customers and consumers to deliver the best products. At PepsiCo, we are committed to performing well as individuals and in teams, and to strengthen the company as a whole. Are you hungry to be a part of the world’s largest portfolio of billion-dollar food and beverage brands? Then now is the time to explore the Possibilities of PepsiCo. Your Responsibilities: The Maintenance Manager leads a maintenance department that includes front line supervisors and a team of mechanics. She or he is responsible for people and team development, motivating the team and ensuring quality performance. Responsibilities include cost efficiency, continuous improvement on processes, service, and safety for an entire business unit across all shifts. Responsibilities include achieving site performance for uptime, equipment reliability, overall equipment effectiveness, and building/grounds maintenance. This role will also coach team members to utilize the processes and facilitate problem solving on the floor. Major Tasks, Accountabilities and Key Responsibilities: Ensure that supervisors and teams within the business unit are developed and held accountable for achieving individual, team and business unit goals Solve day-to-day operational issues and reach short- and long-term performance goals Deliver effective change leadership while driving business changes and minimizing people impact Builds people capability through effective employee relations, hiring, training, and communication for front-line hourly and salaried personnel Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally to assist team to solve operational issues Work closely with suppliers and internal customers to deliver expected results Conduct presentations and formal training programs This role requires regular presence on the plant floor and may require occasional work in poor weather conditions, including heat, cold, rain, or snow. This role may require off-shift and weekend work Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. For specific information, please discuss role requirements with the recruiter. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required. Preferably in engineering, business, operations management, or similar field Lean Six Sigma Experience preferred, proven by successful completion of a major improvement project. A minimum of 5 years of operations maintenance experience preferred along with 2 years of supervisor experience Ability to think quickly, take initiative, think creatively and challenge team to do the same Possess strong skills in project management Proven ability to work in a results-oriented, dynamic environment Strong leadership skills with the ability to get results through mentoring others This position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States Must have a valid driver’s license Safe driving record strongly preferred We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Overview The Maintenance Manager leads a maintenance department that includes front line supervisors and a team of mechanics. She or he is responsible for people and team development, motivating the team and ensuring quality performance. Responsibilities include cost efficiency, continuous improvement on processes, service, and safety for an entire business unit across all shifts. This role will also include achieving site performance for uptime, equipment reliability, overall equipment effectiveness, and building/grounds maintenance. This role will also coach team members to utilize the processes and facilitate problem solving on the floor. The Maintenance Manager role is a highly technical role critical to plant operations. Tulsa Oklahoma is also leading the way for PBNA as being the first site in North America to launch PGT. Full leadership staffing is critical to the success of this massive transformational project. Responsibilities Ensure that front line supervisors and teams within the business unit are developed and held accountable for achieving individual, team and business unit goals Develop team to solve day-to-day operational issues and reach short- and long-term performance goals Deliver effective change leadership while driving business changes and minimizing people impact Builds people capability through effective employee relations, hiring, training, and communication for front-line hourly and salaried personnel Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally to assist team to solve operational issues Motivate and hold team members accountable to achieve plan goals Organize and facilitate work team meetings (examples: pre-shift, roundtables, etc.) Work closely with suppliers and internal customers to deliver expected results Administer policies and procedures Regular and predictable attendance at the work site Initiate and implement projects Conduct presentations and formal training programs Seek out and implement best practices Solve daily operational issues This role requires regular presence on the plant floor This role occasionally requires lifting up to 40 lbs. This role requires occasional work in poor weather conditions, including heat, cold, rain, or snow. This role may operate forklift and manufacturing equipment occasionally This role may require off-shift and weekend work This role may require some travel (less than 5%) Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required. Preferably in engineering, business, operations management, or similar field Lean Six Sigma Experience preferred, demonstrated by successful completion of a major improvement project. A minimum of 5 years of operations maintenance experience preferred A minimum of 2 years of supervisory experience preferred Ability to think quickly, take initiative, think creatively and challenge team to do the same Must possess strong skills in project management Ability to work in an unstructured environment while making decisions quickly Proficient in Microsoft Suite applications Ability to give and receive constructive feedback Ability to lead a team-based approach to decision making Demonstrated ability to work in a results-oriented, challenging environment Strong leadership skills with the ability to get results through mentoring others Effective coaching, facilitation, presentation, and team building skills The position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. For specific information, please discuss role requirements with the recruiter Compensation and Benefits: The expected Compensation range for this position is between $81,000 - $135,600 Location confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary. Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement. In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan. PBNA 36.14 CLICK HERE to view our Maintenance Mechanic Job Preview Video Full Time/Nights $36.14 per hour Practical (Hands On) & Written Exam Position is responsible for repairing and installing advanced production/manufacturing equipment. Inspects equipment for proper functioning and performs preventative maintenance duties per manufacturer's specifications. May mentor and provide support to less experienced mechanics. Diagnoses equipment malfunctions and makes more complicated repairs or adjustments as needed. Must have own hand tools. This position requires continuous work near heat, noise, gas, and chemicals. The position requires frequent lifting, climbing, standing, walking, crouching, squatting, bending and kneeling. The position may require weekend and/or holiday work. PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Perform preventative maintenance on more advanced/sophisticated production equipment Perform repairs on more advanced production equipment as needed Perform breakdown analysis Oversee or perform general housekeepingUpgrade production lines with new/upgraded equipment/technology Direct activities of outside contractors working on assigned line Change line for package changeovers Enforce GMP, safety, and audit standards Work independently under limited supervision (self-management) Documentation of work schedule and work tasks completed BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 18 years or older Pass technical assessment addressing job-critical maintenance knowledge areas Experience with basic electrical systems (e.g., starters, fuses, contacts, relays) Experience with electrical systems (installation, frequency drive, troubleshooting) Experience with product manuals (e.g., reading and applying knowledge to make repairs). Experience with schematics (e.g., electrical blueprints with switches, starters, maps, relays). Experience with troubleshooting mechanical breakdowns (pinpointing and fixing breakdowns). Experience with troubleshooting (e.g., diagnostics, problem solving, etc.). Experience with reading mechanical drawings (e.g., hydraulics, pneumatics). Must be able to sufficiently read, write and speak English due to the safety sensitivity of this role. HELPFUL EXPERIENCE: Experience with mechanical systems (e.g., gear boxes, chains, sprockets, motors, seals, bearings). Experience with compressors/ammonia systems (e.g., refrigeration systems). Experience with conveyers and airveyors (air cylinders, diverters, sensors, motor/speed controls). Experience with electronics (e.g., level probes, flow meters, drives/VFDs, etc.). Experience with gearing and gear boxes (rebuilds, ordering parts, machining parts). Experience with hydraulic systems (high pressure cylinders, pumps, valves, troubleshooting). Experience with kinematics (e.g., line speed/sprocket size ratios, etc.). Review rating instructions. Experience with packaging/high speed production (e.g., bottling, consumer products, etc.). Experience with PLC (e.g., industrial maintenance, computer control systems, etc.). Experience with pneumatics (solenoids, cylinders, motor brakes, reading, troubleshooting). Experience with pneumatics/air compression (e.g., valves, cylinders, etc.). Experience with preventative maintenance (computerized preventative charts/data). Experience with pumps (e.g., troubleshooting, replacing seals/motors, understanding specs). Experience with SERVO (e.g., intelligent/robotic motors, in-coders, etc.). Experience working in team based environments (working together with others). The Global IT team supports just that with our mission to create more smiles with every CLICK and every LIKE. Join our global, agile team and help us influence and drive PepsiCo’s digital transformation! Within the Cyber Fusion Center organization, the Malware Analysis Specialist is responsible for fortifying cybersecurity defense, detection and response capabilities through threat intelligence derived from malware reverse engineering. Perform Malware Analysis of samples originating from digital investigations and automation pipelines, or collected as part of on-demand proactive malware review Execute diverse sample reverse engineering activities (manual inspection, sandboxing, static, dynamic, emulation, etc.) and deep-dive into malicious code (on-disk or in-memory), manually or using tools, to allow sample determination, malware attribution, threat profile updates (IOCs & TTPs) and malware config extraction Determine, validate, document and share malware behavior with other Cyber Fusion Center teams (intent, capabilities, exploitability) Come up with hunt and detection ideas based on your malware analysis results and support detection team with their implementation Mentor and supervise analysis efforts of junior staff Produce detailed technical reports and presentations in support of malware investigations Drive/coordinate projects requiring Malware Analysis expertise Maintain and develop malware lab’s capabilities, contribute to the development of customized technical solution sets to monitor, analyze and extract data from malware Provide timely, comprehensive and accurate information to Information Security leadership in both written and verbal communications. Keep up to speed with current developments in malware analysis/reverse engineering tools, techniques, and practices Create and deliver custom trainings to CFC and InfoSec teams, coach your peers Support on-demand antivirus definitions testing needs Collaborate with CFC teams on project execution and PepsiCo security improvements by leveraging automation and NextGen technologies Routinely develop and update malware analysis documentation and processes, to ensure it remains aligned with industry best practices and latest tool development Bring up innovative ideas, based on your own experience or information gathered from external communities, and actively participate into malware analysis function’s growth Review and resolve project/initiatives requirements according to established timelines Maintain a professional communicative relationship with InfoSec peers and PepsiCo users throughout the malware analysis cycles Ensure team success through organizational, functional, and team alignment towards team mission and objectives Develop the requisite expertise, knowledge, and ability to perform independently Participate in after-hours activities when required Qualifications 5+ years of work experience in information security, especially in a security operations role (e.g. IR, Malware Analysis), is required Bachelor or Master's degree in Information Technology or related discipline is required Information Security certifications such as GREM are a plus Proficiency in triaging unknown malicious samples (e.g. documents, scripts, PE files) Knowledge of debuggers and common binary file formats, hands-on experience with IDA Pro or equivalent Proven ability to build malware config extractors Experience with YARA and IPS rules Proficient in programming (e.g. C/C(, .NET, assembly) and scripting languages (e.g. Python, PowerShell, Java) Ability to identify and defeat malware anti-analysis mechanisms Hands-on experience with static and dynamic analysis, and industry standard tools for malware reverse engineering Knowledge of memory forensics to identify and understand memory resident malware Very good English, both written and spoken Solid customer orientation with excellent oral and written communication skills A team-focused mentality with the proven ability to work effectively with diverse stakeholders An ability to effectively influence others to modify their opinions, plans, or behaviors Proactive attitude, seeking for improvement opportunities which can positively impact the security posture and the business Overview This position contributes to the success of the PepsiCo Beverages North America (PBNA) by ensuring regulatory compliance (OSHA, EPA, and DOT), accident prevention and after injury management. This person will work to support implementation of the PBNA EHS Management System at the Riverside, CA manufacturing/warehousing location. The ideal candidate will be a subject matter expert in employee safety and environmental regulations as well as have OSHA, EPA, and DOT compliance experience and be highly skilled at implementing processes that will lead to sustained EHS performance improvements. This person is responsible for deploying, implementing, and leading the EHS agenda by supporting the location manufacturing teams with integration of safety and environmental programs, Workers' Compensation, prevention efforts, and regulatory compliance into everyday work life. The EHS Manager has responsibility to analyze accident data and develop and implement actionable safety/environmental solutions. The candidate is expected to provide collaborative, proactive, and creative problem-solving abilities to develop best-in-class EHS programs for the improvement of the overall strategy and EHS management system. Responsibilities Implement, execute, ensure compliance with the Pepsi - North American Beverages EHS policies and procedures, and all federal, state, and local OSHA/EPA/ (i.e. Lockout, Haz Com, Machine Safety, SARA, RCRA, etc.) Manage local EHS budget Lead the development and implementation of the EHS Annual Operating Plans and EHS Action Plans for the location Achieve annual targets rates for Lost Time, Recordable, Severity, and Environmental Ensure compliance with applicable occupational safety and environmental regulations Develop, implement, execute, and manage strategies to prevent workplace injuries, and environmental incidents Demonstrate solid employee relations experience, interpersonal and verbal/written communication skills Display strong problem solving, organizational and analytical skills Demonstrate professional maturity and ability to act as a change leader by influencing all levels of the organization to drive continuous improvement in safety performance Conduct EHS activities such as training/auditing/assessing to ensure ongoing compliance with regulatory agency requirements, Zero Zone Management System standards, Emergency Response and and internal PepsiCo EHS procedures Perform risk assessments and assist in the implementation of effective physical and/ or behavioral control measures. Recognize and verify the effectiveness of in-place control measures Identify unsafe equipment operation and conditions while demonstrating knowledge of appropriate corrective action for unsafe conditions or equipment use Exercise a leadership, coordination, and communication role with the location leadership to drive continuous EHS improvement across the location Complete root cause analyses and develop corrective action plans to address root basic causes and management system weak-spots through the use of industry-recognized cause analysis techniques Qualifications Bachelor's Degree with greater than 10 years’ work experience in EHS Effective communication and interpersonal skills including public speaking skills and presence in meetings and training environments Ability to: make and deliver training presentations work collaboratively with colleagues to create a results driven, team oriented environment maintain confidentiality make independent decisions demonstrate excellent organizational skills use PC and related software (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) handle multiple priorities and meet critical deadlines Preferred Job Qualifications: Safety management experience in a related industry, including consumer packaged goods, distribution/transportation, manufacturing or grocery industry Safety degree and/or related certification Knowledge and experience with EHS Management systems and their deployment EHS auditing ASP, CSP, CIH, and/or CHMM desirable Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. jobDescription: Overview The People Scheduler/Payroll Admin works with the Supply Chain Leaders and frontline team members on shift to ensure scheduling needs are covered in compliance with policy and contractual guidelines while supporting labor efficiency targets. Primarily works Monday – Friday 1st shift (5 am – 2 pm) Responsibilities Scheduling personnel for all of manufacturing (primarily focused on 1st shift production coverage) In-depth knowledge of manufacturing contract language as pertaining to scheduling Attendance, vacation, & qualification tracking Calling in and calling off employees Accountable and responsible for all aspects of payroll for Team Members Process payroll data weekly for 300+ Team Members Obtains information for payroll production and tax related issues Interacts with management and Team Members for validation on data Responds to/resolves Team Member's questions and problems Processes pay adjustments, special payments, tax allocations, Team Member deductions as needed Supports HR with updates to Team Member data due to bidding, etc. Maintains complete confidentiality Maintains Team Member data with the time keeping system Ensuring proper authorized signatures on submissions and/or changes Facilitates New Employee Orientation as it relates to Kronos, payroll, vacation and holiday accruals Backfills other key admin roles, as needed Other duties as assigned to support the site Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. Overview Position reports to the facility Organizational Capability leader and is responsible for the coordination and execution of Manufacturing and Warehouse training, including (but not limited to) safety, food safety, equipment operations, role performance, plant operations, maintenance, and quality control training. Position is responsible for developing, coordinating, and executing the onboarding of new hire and new-to-role employees. Position will serve as the lead for creating document-based training plans for designated roles in the plant. Position will be responsible for producing and validating standard training and onboarding documents including Standard Operating Procedures and One-Point Lessons. Position will work with Environmental, Health and Safety and Quality departments to track, plan and report out on quarterly and annual training requirements. Position is responsible for accuracy and maintenance of all required training processes and records. Position requires ability/proficiency in Microsoft Office for developing onboarding and capability documents as well as developing and using organizational tools. Position may require lifting, carrying, and pushing/pulling cases weighing 20-45 pounds per case over the course of the work shift. Position requires ability to stand most of the bid shift and may include stooping, crawling and crouching under and around manufacturing or warehousing equipment. Position will include working weekends and/or holidays. Responsibilities Ensure adherence to personal safety and food safety requirements during the conduct of all training Ensure all training for manufacturing and warehousing operations is conducted in a safe manner Coordinate and ensure the execution of onboarding and training for new hire and new-to-department employees Standardize and continuously improve the onboarding for new hire and new-to-department employees Coordinate and ensure the execution of manufacturing and warehousing safety training including PIT and ergonomic certification Maintain tracker for required training programs to ensure timely completion of initial and refresher training Track and own action plans for Key Process Metrics indicating the effectiveness of training Develop and train continuous improvement processes and standards for warehouse employees Research, find answers and follow-up with employees for questions that arise during training Work with minimal supervision and guidance on a day-to-day basis Communicate proactively and effectively with employees ranging from facility leaders to team members for planning and executing training requirements Work with and coach Subject-Matter Experts, role trainers and team on adherence to and execution of existing policies, procedures and best practices Demonstrate consistent, punctual attendance Compensation: The expected Compensation range for this position is between $39,800 -$55,400 Location confirmed job-related skills and experience will be considered in setting actual starting salary Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement. In addition to salary, PepsiCo offers a comprehensive benefits package to support our employees and their families, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan Qualifications 18 years or older Pass the Drug Test Pass the Background Check Pass the Ergonomic Test RELEVANT EXPERIENCES AND CAPABILITIES: Demonstrated ability to influence and work with others in a continuously operating, fast-paced manufacturing or warehousing environment Demonstrated ability to follow through with and complete assignments with minimal supervision Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects at the same time and switch between unrelated tasks Experience powered industrial truck or material handling equipment operation Experience with personal and machine safety programs (including but not limited to Personal Protective Equipment and Lockout-Tagout) Experience with safety training including ergonomics and powered industrial trucks (i.e. pallet jacks, forklifts) Thorough understanding of food safety compliance (e.g., basic procedures/steps, sanitization, good manufacturing practices in a food plant, ability to identify and resolve risks) Experience with Total Productive Manufacturing tasks and/or Lean Manufacturing systems Experience training others in formalized programs Basic competency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Word, Excel and Powerpoint Experience with Performance-Based Training programs Experience with Manufacturing and Warehousing operations (producing to schedule, shipping to schedule, understanding production planning and deadlines, managing time-based changeovers) Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. Responsibilities Analyze and ensure flawless execution and implementation of all business proposal initiatives related to material supply. This involves obtaining the specifications of the item(s) from R&D. Communicate all changes and new business plans to producing plants as well as suppliers. Support base business; minimize system inventory and obsolescence while driving overall productivity. Provide leadership and direction in multi-functional taskforce meetings, conference calls, etc. to develop strategies to execute business change with suppliers that leverage productivity, best practices and vendor managed inventories. Ensure sufficient inventory at suppliers and plants during emergencies or other non-routine shipments. Requires strong communication and prioritization skills. Assure back-up supplier supply capability. Ensure accurate inventory quantities and timely delivery of materials to execute business change and new product rollout. Develop and execute material run out strategies to minimize material obsolescence related to business change. Develop strategic business partnerships with suppliers leveraging integrated business systems, best practices and vendor managed inventory. Establish vendor service criteria and develop strategic plans to address future business. Define performance metrics and scorecard supplier’s performance. Identify, lead, or support special projects ensuring on-time execution. Develop productivity initiatives that deliver continuous improvement. Interact closely with Marketing, Marketing Services, Product Supply, and R&D to support innovation and productivity initiatives. Develop plans and action steps that ensure flawless executive of new business initiatives. Qualifications B.S. Degree Required 5+ years of experience in Supply Chain role (manufacturing, product supply, co-pack, etc) Working knowledge of material planning. Knowledge of supply chain fundamentals and experience applying these fundamentals Results oriented, innovative thinker with a focus on continuous process improvement Strong strategic and analytical skills with the ability to focus on the big picture, as well as manage details Must have strong verbal and written communication skills, and collaboration abilities across all levels of the organization Must be able to multi-task, as well as shift priorities Effective in working in teams, which is essential in working with suppliers, Frito-Lay plants, co-packers and other HQ functions Solid organizational skills and project management experience Note : COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law. and orderly condition Communicate store issues to store managers and Pepsi management Build customer relationships at the store level Comply with operating procedures (e.g., scan-in/scan-out, etc.) Ability to operate under minimal supervision (self-managed role) Use hand held devices to write/input orders Regular, reliable, predictable attendance BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 18 years or older
